   20: 
   21: -module(message_queue_data_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1]).
   24: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: -export([basic/1, process_info_messages/1, total_heap_size/1,
   26: 	 change_to_off_heap/1, change_to_off_heap_gc/1]).
   27: 
   28: -export([basic_test/1, id/1]).
   29: 
   30: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   31: 
   32: suite() ->
   33:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   34:      {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   35: 
   36: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   37:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   38:     Config.
   39: 
   40: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   41:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
   42:     ok.
   43: 
   44: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   45:     Config.
   46: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   47:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   48: 
   49: all() ->
   50:     [basic, process_info_messages, total_heap_size, change_to_off_heap,
   51:      change_to_off_heap_gc].
   52: 
   53: %%
   54: %%
   55: %% Test cases
   56: %%
   57: %%
   58: 
   59: basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   60: 
   61:     basic_test(erlang:system_info(message_queue_data)),
   62: 
   63:     {ok, Peer1, Node1} = ?CT_PEER(["+hmqd", "off_heap"]),
   64:     ok = rpc:call(Node1, ?MODULE, basic_test, [off_heap]),
   65:     peer:stop(Peer1),
   66: 
   67:     {ok, Peer2, Node2} = ?CT_PEER(["+hmqd", "on_heap"]),
   68:     ok = rpc:call(Node2, ?MODULE, basic_test, [on_heap]),
   69:     peer:stop(Peer2),
   70: 
   71:     ok.
   72: 
   73: is_valid_mqd_value(off_heap) ->
   74:     true;
   75: is_valid_mqd_value(on_heap) ->
   76:     true;
   77: is_valid_mqd_value(_) ->
   78:     false.
   79: 
   80: 
   81: basic_test(Default) ->
   82: 
   83:     Default = erlang:system_info(message_queue_data),
   84:     true = is_valid_mqd_value(Default),
   85: 
   86:     {message_queue_data, Default} = process_info(self(), message_queue_data),
   87:     Default = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
   88:     {message_queue_data, off_heap} = process_info(self(), message_queue_data),
   89:     off_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, on_heap),
   90:     {message_queue_data, on_heap} = process_info(self(), message_queue_data),
   91:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch process_flag(message_queue_data, blupp)),
   92: 
   93:     P1 = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end,
   94: 		   [link]),
   95:     {message_queue_data, Default} = process_info(P1, message_queue_data),
   96:     unlink(P1),
   97:     exit(P1, bye),
   98: 
   99:     P2 = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end,
  100: 		   [link, {message_queue_data, off_heap}]),
  101:     {message_queue_data, off_heap} = process_info(P2, message_queue_data),
  102:     unlink(P2),
  103:     exit(P2, bye),
  104: 
  105:     P3 = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end,
  106: 		   [link, {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  107:     {message_queue_data, on_heap} = process_info(P3, message_queue_data),
  108:     unlink(P3),
  109:     exit(P3, bye),
  110: 
  111:     {'EXIT', _} = (catch spawn_opt(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end,
  112: 		   [link, {message_queue_data, blapp}])),
  113: 
  114:     ok.
  115: 
  116: process_info_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  117:     Tester = self(),
  118:     P1 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  119: 			   receive after 500 -> ok end,
  120: 			   on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  121: 			   Tester ! first,
  122: 			   receive after 500 -> ok end,
  123: 			   off_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, on_heap),
  124: 			   Tester ! second,
  125: 			   receive after 500 -> ok end,
  126: 			   on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  127: 			   Tester ! third,
  128: 			    
  129: 			   receive after infinity -> ok end
  130: 		   end,
  131: 		   [link, {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  132:     
  133:     P1 ! "A",
  134:     receive first -> ok end,
  135:     P1 ! "B",
  136:     receive second -> ok end,
  137:     P1 ! "C",
  138:     receive third -> ok end,
  139:     P1 ! "D",
  140: 
  141:     {messages, ["A", "B", "C", "D"]} = process_info(P1, messages),
  142: 
  143:     P2 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  144: 			   receive after 500 -> ok end,
  145: 			   on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  146: 			   Tester ! first,
  147: 			   receive after 500 -> ok end,
  148: 			   off_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, on_heap),
  149: 			   Tester ! second,
  150: 			   receive after 500 -> ok end,
  151: 			   on_heap = process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  152: 			   Tester ! third,
  153: 			   receive after 500 -> ok end,
  154: 
  155: 			   Tester ! process_info(self(), messages),
  156: 
  157: 			   receive M1 -> M1 = "A" end,
  158: 			   receive M2 -> M2 = "B" end,
  159: 			   receive M3 -> M3 = "C" end,
  160: 			   receive M4 -> M4 = "D" end,
  161: 
  162: 			   Tester ! self()
  163: 		   end,
  164: 		   [link, {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  165: 
  166:     P2 ! "A",
  167:     receive first -> ok end,
  168:     P2 ! "B",
  169:     receive second -> ok end,
  170:     P2 ! "C",
  171:     receive third -> ok end,
  172:     P2 ! "D",
  173: 
  174:     receive
  175: 	Msg ->
  176: 	    {messages, ["A", "B", "C", "D"]} = Msg
  177:     end,
  178:     
  179:     receive P2 -> ok end,
  180: 
  181:     ok.
  182: 
  183: total_heap_size(_Config) ->
  184: 
  185:     Fun = fun F() -> receive Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> Pid ! ok,F() end end,
  186: 
  187:     %% Test that on_heap messages grow the heap even if they are not received
  188:     OnPid = spawn_opt(Fun, [{message_queue_data, on_heap},link]),
  189:     {total_heap_size, OnSize} = erlang:process_info(OnPid, total_heap_size),
  190:     [OnPid ! lists:duplicate(N,N) || N <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  191:     OnPid ! self(), receive ok -> ok end,
  192:     {total_heap_size, OnSizeAfter} = erlang:process_info(OnPid, total_heap_size),
  193:     ct:log("OnSize = ~p, OnSizeAfter = ~p",[OnSize, OnSizeAfter]),
  194:     true = OnSize < OnSizeAfter,
  195: 
  196:     %% Test that off_heap messages do not grow the heap if they are not received
  197:     OffPid = spawn_opt(Fun, [{message_queue_data, off_heap},link]),
  198:     {total_heap_size, OffSize} = erlang:process_info(OffPid, total_heap_size),
  199:     [OffPid ! lists:duplicate(N,N) || N <- lists:seq(1,100)],
  200:     OffPid ! self(), receive ok -> ok end,
  201:     {total_heap_size, OffSizeAfter} = erlang:process_info(OffPid, total_heap_size),
  202:     ct:log("OffSize = ~p, OffSizeAfter = ~p",[OffSize, OffSizeAfter]),
  203:     true = OffSize == OffSizeAfter.
  204: 
  205: change_to_off_heap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  206:     %% Without seq-trace tokens on messages...
  207:     change_to_off_heap_test(),
  208:     %% With seq-trace tokens on messages...
  209:     Tracer = start_seq_tracer(),
  210:     try
  211: 	change_to_off_heap_test()
  212:     after
  213: 	stop_seq_tracer(Tracer)
  214:     end,
  215:     ok.
  216: 
  217: change_to_off_heap_test() ->
  218:     process_flag(message_queue_data, on_heap),
  219:     process_flag(min_heap_size, 1000000),
  220:     garbage_collect(),
  221:     persistent_term:put(mqd_test_ref, make_ref()),
  222:     try
  223: 	Alias = alias(),
  224: 	%% A lot of on-heap messages to convert in the change...
  225: 	Msgs = make_misc_messages(Alias, persistent_term:get(mqd_test_ref)),
  226: 	%% io:format("Msgs: ~p~n",[Msgs]),
  227: 	process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  228: 	wait_change_off_heap(),
  229: 	%% All messages in message queue have now been moved off-heap...
  230: 	RecvMsgs = recv_msgs(),
  231: 	unalias(Alias),
  232: 	%% io:format("RecvMsgs: ~p~n",[RecvMsgs]),
  233: 	true = Msgs =:= RecvMsgs,
  234: 	garbage_collect(),
  235: 	persistent_term:erase(mqd_test_ref),
  236: 	receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  237: 	garbage_collect(),
  238: 	true = Msgs =:= RecvMsgs
  239:     after
  240:  	persistent_term:erase(mqd_test_ref)
  241:     end.
  242: 
  243: start_seq_tracer() ->
  244:     Tester = self(),
  245:     Go = make_ref(),
  246:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
  247: 			     seq_trace:set_system_tracer(self()),
  248: 			     Tester ! Go,
  249: 			     seq_trace_loop([])
  250: 		     end),
  251:     receive
  252: 	Go ->
  253: 	    seq_trace:set_token(label,666),
  254: 	    seq_trace:set_token('receive',true),
  255: 	    Pid
  256:     end.
  257: 
  258: stop_seq_tracer(Tracer) ->
  259:     Ref = make_ref(),
  260:     Tracer ! {stop, Ref, self()},
  261:     receive
  262: 	{Ref, SeqTrace} ->
  263: 	    io:format("SeqTrace: ~p~n", [SeqTrace])
  264:     end.
  265: 
  266: seq_trace_loop(SeqTrace) ->
  267:     receive
  268: 	{seq_trace,_Label,_Info,_Ts} = ST->
  269: 	    seq_trace_loop([ST|SeqTrace]);
  270: 	{seq_trace,_Label,_Info} = ST ->
  271: 	    seq_trace_loop([ST|SeqTrace]);
  272: 	{stop,Ref,From} ->
  273: 	    From ! {Ref,lists:reverse(SeqTrace)}
  274:     end.
  275: 
  276: make_misc_messages(Alias, Lit) ->
  277:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  278:     make_misc_messages(Alias, Lit, [], 100).
  279: 
  280: make_misc_messages(_Alias, _Lit, Msgs, N) when N =< 0 ->
  281:     lists:flatten(lists:reverse(Msgs));
  282: make_misc_messages(Alias, Lit, Msgs, N) ->
  283:     M1 = Lit,
  284:     M2 = {Lit, N},
  285:     M3 = immediate,
  286:     M4 = {not_immediate, N},
  287:     exit(self(), tjena), %% Will become off-heap msg...
  288:     %% Rest will become on-heap msgs...
  289:     self() ! M1,
  290:     self() ! M2,
  291:     self() ! M3,
  292:     self() ! M4,
  293:     Alias ! M1,
  294:     Alias ! M2,
  295:     Alias ! M3,
  296:     Alias ! M4,
  297:     NewMsgs = [{'EXIT', self(), tjena},
  298: 	       M1, M2, M3, M4, M1, M2, M3, M4],
  299:     make_misc_messages(Alias, Lit, [NewMsgs | Msgs], N-9).
  300: 
  301: %% Test that setting message queue to off_heap works if a GC is triggered
  302: %% as the message queue if moved off heap. See GH-5933 for more details.
  303: %% This testcase will most likely only fail in debug build.
  304: change_to_off_heap_gc(_Config) ->
  305:     Msg = {ok, lists:duplicate(20,20)},
  306: 
  307:     %% We test that this process can receive a message and when it is still
  308:     %% in its external message queue we change the message queue data to
  309:     %% off_heap and then GC.
  310:     {Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(
  311:             fun() ->
  312:                     spinner(1, 10000),
  313:                     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
  314:                     garbage_collect(),
  315:                     receive {ok, _M} -> ok end
  316:             end),
  317:     Pid ! Msg,
  318:     receive
  319:         {'DOWN',Ref,_,_,_} ->
  320:             ok
  321:     end.
  322: 
  323: %%
  324: %%
  325: %% helpers
  326: %%
  327: %%
  328: 
  329: wait_change_off_heap() ->
  330:     %%
  331:     %% Will wait until a change to off_heap message_queue_data
  332:     %% has been made on current process if (and only if) it
  333:     %% was previously changed on this process...
  334:     %%
  335:     %% Work with *current* implementation! This may change...
  336:     %%
  337:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, thread_progress),
  338:     %% We have now flushed later ops including later op that
  339:     %% sent 'adjust msgq' signal to us. Now pass a message
  340:     %% through our message queue. When received we know that
  341:     %% that the 'adjust message queue' signal has been
  342:     %% handled...
  343:     %%
  344:     Ref = make_ref(),
  345:     self() ! Ref,
  346:     receive Ref -> ok end.
  347:     
  348: recv_msgs() ->    
  349:     recv_msgs([]).
  350: 
  351: recv_msgs(Msgs) ->
  352:     receive
  353: 	Msg ->
  354: 	    recv_msgs([Msg|Msgs])
  355:     after 0 ->
  356: 	    lists:reverse(Msgs)
  357:     end.
  358: 
  359: %% This spinner needs to make sure that it does not allocate any memory
  360: %% as a GC in here will break the test
  361: spinner(_N, 0) -> ok;
  362: spinner(N, M) -> spinner(?MODULE:id(N) div 1, M - 1).
  363: 
  364: id(N) -> N.
